file_content.text: Welcome to Rishi. Gorgeous beaches, pirate hideouts, and over six hundred open bounties. Too bad the HoloNet signal's weak--otherwise, it's perfect.
Raider's Cove. Shoddy defenses. Lots of hiding spots. Pretty beach.
You know I like my beach resorts with character, but this particular character seems a little less "eccentric" and a little more "spice-addled." Welcome to Rishi.
Take a slice of Nar Shaddaa and drop it on the beach, and you've got Raider's Cove. Don't lean against anything--it might collapse.
So this is Rishi. Heard a little about it back on Hoth--pirates talked about it like it was some vacation hangout. Got to admit, the view's not bad.
Every planet we visit--I still feel a thrill when we land. Look at the ocean! Does this ever get old?
I have seen many things, but never a black beach on a golden sea. This will be an excellent world for us.
Spent a week on Rishi once. Nasty bunch, even for pirates. Did things I don't like to think about.
It's a beautiful planet for such an ugly spaceport. I wish we could do something about it--but that's not why we're here.
Smell that, my lord? That's the smell of low-quality blaster cartridges leaking tibanna gas. That's who we're dealing with on Rishi--very cheap, very violent people.
This may be the saddest, most run-down port I've ever seen. I've said that before, but you keep surprising me.
Viidu used to talk about retiring to Rishii. Never was sure if he was serious--always seemed he was a little scared of the place.
My father took me to Rishi once when I was a little girl. I was scared of the black sand, but by the end... it was a good trip.
Guess this is Rishi. I think I might've been here before--it was a long week, I was trashed for most of it, but that skyline looks familiar....
Warm sun on black sand. We've seen sights like this in the memories of the nest, but never with our own eyes. Thank you.
"Raider's Cove." Name like that tells you something--the locals don't even bother to pretend they're not scum.
There's so little about Rishi in our databanks--it's all secondhand accounts from smugglers and raiders. People who go this far from civilization like their privacy.
Observation: This spaceport appears to be in dire need of maintenance. Stripped wires, spilled oil, and unsound construction may all be to our advantage.
Query: Why bother caging and feeding the prisoners instead of working them indefinitely? Surely their resale value cannot be high after much use.
To capture a prisoner is a great thing! A happy event to be celebrated with a feast! These Nova Blades have no joy or respect for victory.
Slaves--the cargo of the stupid and sadistic. Way too bulky and way more trouble than they're worth. Most of the time.
We don't know what the political answer is to slavery. But here and now, we can set these people free.
When I was a kid, I'd sometimes slice bounty boards and put bounties on slavers. I felt bad for not paying out, but slavers are jerks.
Slaving is like hunting mice. No challenge. No honor. Cruel to the mice. Shoot to kill.
There's good money in slaving, but it's a business I won't touch. If there's one thing you've taught me, Sith, it's that slaves can get mean.
Were you really a slave once? I just can't imagine you in one of these cages. I can't imagine you... helpless.
I believe there's a place for slavery in the galaxy--I won't deny that. But certain standards should be upheld. These men lack standards.
No jokes, no smart comments... every slaver here--every scumbag who treats people like property--has to die. We have to kill them.
Look at these people. We'll do what we can, but they need a good two, three months of physical and nutritional therapy to recover. Not even counting the psychological damage.
Every day we're out fighting the Empire is a day we could have been stopping slaver scumbags. Just another thing to hate the Sith for.
I know it's not why we're on Rishi, Jedi, but blast it... no innocent person deserves to be in a cage like that.
It's not the cruelty that surprises me. It's that this goes on, ignored, in so many corners of the galaxy. Let's help these people, if we can.
Ah, look at these people, Captain. Even outlaws need to have limits. Slaving goes way past respectable crime.
Someone in the Nova Blades must be very proud of enslaving instead of killing the people who refuse to pay protection. They probably think it's ethical. I don't.
Had a run-in with slavers second year out of training. I still can't forget the smell--unwashed, unfed people caged in their own dirt. Blast it all.
My family owned slaves. I don't want to admit how long it took me to realize that was wrong. Let's do this properly.
Analysis: Overloading the Nova Blades' ship reactor will likely not prove feasible. Unfortunate, as a full-scale meltdown would prove quite spectacular.
Look! Had a ship so large crashed on my homeworld, I would have brought my whole tribe to the stars. We would have won battles endless!
Look at that ship. Imagine being on the bridge when it went down. We have got to try that.
The hive-ship burrows into the heart of the world, bearing life and sickness in equal measure.
I've been doing some research. The Nova Blades used to let their members marry and raise kids--they had their own culture. Now it's mostly just killing.
Heavy defenses. Clean, though. Not used to frontal attacks. Let's go.
Had a friend or two in the Nova Blades. Better shooters and better flyers than I was. Don't mind killing them now--if we can pull it off.
I never thought a pirate crew could rival the White Maw. These guys may not be an army, but they've sure got the firepower of one.
"Project Meteorite" proposed ramming Imperial cruisers through Republic blockades and using them as staging grounds once they crashed. It seems the Nova Blades beat us to it.
"Nova Blades." "Nova Blades." If I ever start a pirate crew, I'm going to call them the "Star Stabbers."
Look, if you crashed your ship more than a decade ago and you're still living in the mess, it's time to grow up. Get an apartment and a housekeeper.
"Nova Blades," huh? Takes a lot of guts to name yourself after a fiery sword when you don't carry lightsabers. Guts, but not smarts.
That's a mean-looking ship, but looks are all it's got. Nova Blades have it jury-rigged to all get-out--we do this smart, we can take them on.
I should feel sorry for the Nova Blades--they're only pawns here. But the things they do for greed are hard to forgive.
Says something about the Nova Blades that they didn't join the White Maw or the Voidwolf. Says something about how much firepower they've got, too.
It doesn't matter how big or fast a pirate band grows--egos grow bigger and faster. The Nova Blades could use a lesson in humility.
One thing about fighting pirates: They keep you on your toes. No tactics, no discipline, and a lot of messy surprises.
I understand this used to be the bread-and-butter of the Republic Army: large-scale action against militarized pirates. Pity the tactical reports are all outdated.
Warning: I am not programmed with biological data for the Rishii, master. Should engagement prove necessary, my approach may seem grisly and inelegant.
Do not trust these creatures, Chief. Too big, talons endless. They will hunt us for sure, but I will wear their beaks with pride!
You'd think their feathers would be worth something, but... nah. If they were, someone would already be poaching 'em.
We could spend a year among the Rishii and still leave unsatisfied. What do they believe? How do they organize their families? What can the Empire learn from them?
You think the Rishii ever rent their homes to tourists? Tell me you don't want to come back next time we get a week off.
Rishii are predators. Good eyes. Sharp beaks. I'd like to meet a Rishii Mandalorian.
Wouldn't mind having wings, living in a place like this. Some people are born with all the luck, huh?
How do the Rishii stand having those pirates on their world? There's so much beauty here. Why don't they fight?
The Rishii could make fine allies for the Empire. Of the alien species we've recruited, few have natural aerial attack capacity.
Okay, I admit it--the Rishii terrify me. Just look at those beaks! I'm going to have nightmares about being snapped up and eaten.
You ever met a Mrlssi before? Talk about feathers... this one woman loved to have the down on her neck scratched. But I'm not saying try that with the Rishii.
I'm always nervous in places like this. I know the Rishii aren't exactly primitive, but they're not cosmopolitan either. One wrong word and they'll hate the Jedi forever.
Can't say I envy the job, but it's always a joy seeing you play goodwill ambassador to a new species. Let's hope these Rishii stay friendly.
Do you think there are Force-sensitives among the Rishii? I bet there are. I'd like to see a Rishii Jedi fly.
Say, Captain--think it would be wrong to take a feather as a souvenir? I won't pluck it off a Rishii or anything.
I didn't get to see the Rishii last time I was here. Not up close--but I saw one gliding, once. Glad to get a second chance.
Too bad there's not more time. Give me a month, I'd have these Rishii running a militia that would terrify the pirates. They're natural predators.
There's something admirable about the way the Rishii just ignore the outsiders on their world. There's a confidence about them.
Request: I have previously attempted to avoid "friendly fire" incidents, master--but as traditional politics do not apply here, I would like to deactivate that program.
All this because they think Revan is a great chief? But the great chief is hiding! He is not such a great chief.
Joining a cult is basically admitting you have no idea how to live. Fine with me, but don't shoot back when I come gunning for you.
These people have found a home, and it pains us to oppose them. But their belief is not justification for their acts.
You see this? Republic and Empire working together for a common delusion? This is why I don't believe in people.
Empire. Republic. Together but still separate. That's their weakness.
I know you appreciate a good cult, Sith, but these people seem deluded to me. Guess that's kind of the point.
I want to feel happy, seeing Republic and Empire working together. But it's all just a lie.
This is madness, my lord. This is not a convenient alliance or negotiated truce--these are Imperial and Republic soldiers who have forgotten the very reason they once fought.
I guess the good news is: the Empire and the Republic can get along! The bad news is we have to join a murder cult.
Never thought I'd wish people would quit working together and just fight, but--I wish these guys would quit working together and just fight.
How can this many people be so convinced that the Revanites are the real thing? There's got to be a way to make them see reason.
I almost don't want to look too close--I'm afraid of seeing people I served with in this place.
Beliefs, alliances--they can be so fickle sometimes. If you joined the Revanites, would I stay on the right path? I don't know.
Takes a strong man to bring the Republic and Empire together. Not a good man, but a strong one.
I know a thing or two about leaders. This sort of devotion looks good, but it can't be sustained--zealots break, die, or kill their own idols.
What bugs me most about the Revanites isn't that they're defectors--it's that they do it in secret. What Dorne did was brave. These guys and Tavus? Not so much.
The Imperials here would betray their nation for Revan's ideology, but not for true justice. I don't understand it.
Reflection: That particular cave is perfectly sized to hold a top level predator. If desired, I can list the possibilities in alphabetical order.
Look, Chief! That cave is large enough to house a Gorax! Maybe nothing on Rishi is as fierce as a Gorax, but we must always hope.
Something smells in that cave. My guess? A lot of dead big game hunters.
There is a scent here. It is old and powerful, and the nest grows restless at its memory. Be wary of that cave.
Doesn't that cave remind you of the one on Dromund Kaas? The one where you killed "the Beast in the Darkness"? Let's not go in.
Cave's inhabited. Scratch marks, scent, spoor. Big prey. Good hunt. Your call.
Bet you could hide a lot of things in that cave. Guns, cash, maybe even a ship. Given it's Rishi, someone must have tried.
You sense that? There's danger here. Look at that cave. Should we... you know. Do what Jedi and Sith do best?
Note the cave entrance, my lord. Easily large enough to admit a terentatek or similar predator--if Rishi has anything of the sort.
Do you hear breathing coming from that cave? Cave-sized breathing? Let's not get any closer.
Hey--I may not have Jedi senses, but even I know that cave looks bad. Not "interesting bad," either, but just "bad-bad."
They never tell you when you're a Padawan to avoid big, dangerous-looking caves. Guess that's something every Jedi learns on her own.
Check that cave. If Qyzen were here, he'd be molting at the chance to go in. Me, I'm not keeping score.
That cave houses a predator--you can see the marks in the stone. They're beautiful in their way.
Mark that cave on your map for me, will you, Captain? I'd love to come back here one day, make a camp and go exploring.
How big do you figure the predators get on Rishi? I only ask because that's a very big cave....
That cave's a good hiding spot. Problem is, I bet something's already using it.
I think we should avoid that cave, sir. Unnecessary elimination of native predatory species is discouraged by the Unaligned Worlds Protocol Handbook.
Lamentation: The Order of Revan has clearly not understood the secret of Revan's success--proper application of adaptable hunter-killer units.
Sometimes I think of claiming a new ship. But if I take the ship of an enemy, he must be truly great. These ships are not enough for me.
An army of drooling morons and enough blaster stockpiles to keep us shooting for days. You remembered my birthday!
There is beauty in a swarm of ships rising and dancing in the air. Considerably less so when the pilots wish us dead.
Great. So we're not just fighting an army--we're fighting an armada. If you don't ask for a bonus, I will.
Enough ships to wage war. One way to win: stop them on the ground.
Look at those ships. Wouldn't mind having a fleet like that. Don't much want to fight one, though.
Scores of ships and ten times as many cultists. I'm ready for this if you are, my lord.
At a glance, these ships have enough firepower to breach Rishi's crust. They cannot be allowed offworld.
Apparently we could have just landed here. Everyone else did. They wouldn't notice one more, right?
Will you look at those ships? Good news is, if the Revanites decide to pack up and go home, we won't have to give them a ride.
Wow! I know those ships are going to kill everyone we care about, but--wow! If we save the galaxy, can we go joyriding?
Wouldn't mind having an army to back us up on this one. Lots of ships and lots of troops ahead. At least tell me the Force is with us?
I want to lift up those ships and toss them into the sea--then we wouldn't have to fight this battle. But no one's that strong in the Force.
Those are some good-looking ships out there. I know we've got work to do, but I bet we could strip a few parts quick enough...
Always wanted to get my hands on a fleet. Tuning one ship is a joy--synchronizing a hundred sounds like a challenge.
Haven't seen a fleet on the ground like that since Corellia. That many ships could put up a fight against any planet's defenses.
I'll try to record as many images of these ships as I can, sir--even if we win, Republic authorities will want a record of any that escape.
